required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Head Elevation on LMA Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Head Elevation on LMA Supreme Insertion in Patients Undergoing Transurethral Resection of Bladder Tumor: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the first attempt success rate of laryngeal mask airway insertion according to the degree of head elevation.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the first attempt success rate of laryngeal mask airway insertion between 7 cm head elevation and 14 cm head elevation in patients who undergoing transurethral bladder tumor resection.

primary_outcome.description: The rate of success at the first attempt of laryngeal mask airway insertion

secondary_outcome.measure: The percentage of glottic opening score
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of glottic opening by fiberoptic view

secondary_outcome.measure: Laryngeal mask airway insertion-related patient satisfaction

secondary_outcome.description: The rate of success at the second attempt of laryngeal mask airway insertion
The rate of success at the third attempt of laryngeal mask airway insertion

Oropharyngeal leak pressure is measured as follows: After setting the expiratory valve to 30 cmH2O at a fixed gas flow rate of 3 L/min, the maximum inflation pressure is measured when a noise of gas leakage is heard in the oropharynx via a stethoscope.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After mask airway insertion (up to end of surgery)
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of reposition after laryngeal mask airway insertion when ventilation is ineffective or air leaks

secondary_outcome.measure: Complications associated with laryngeal mask airway insertion
secondary_outcome.description: Complications related with laryngeal mask airway insertion such as cough, vomit, aspiration, regurgitation, bleeding, laryngospasm, and bronchospasm

arm_group.description: When inserting laryngeal mask airway, head elevation is performed using a 14 cm high pillow.
When inserting laryngeal mask airway, head elevation is performed using a 7 cm high pillow.

intervention.description: Laryngeal mask airway insertion in patients who undergoing transurethral bladder tumor resection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are scheduled transurethral bladder tumor resection under general anesthesia
- 20-79 years of age
- American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status ≤3
- Patients who are voluntarily agreed to this clinical study
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of difficult airway
- Expected difficult airway by physical examination
- Unstable teeth or teeth loss
- Obesity (body mass index ≥ 30)
- Recent history of upper respiratory infection
- Patients who are not fasted or who are at risk of aspiration
